clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial on Safety and Efficacy of Drug-coated Balloon in Treatment of Coronary Bifurcation Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial on Safety and Efficacy of Drug-coated Balloon in Treatment of Coronary Bifurcation Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of paclitaxel-coated balloon in treatment of coronary bifurcation lesions. This is a feasible study to demonstrate the noninferiority of paclitaxel Drug-coated balloon(DCB) only strategy for bifurcation lesions when compared with traditional single drug eluting stent(DES) strategy, so as to simplify the procedure for treatment of coronary bifurcation lesions and extending the clinical indications of paclitaxel DCB in China.

detailed_description.textblock: Paclitaxel DCB is designed to release anti-proliferative agents to the whole lesion rapidly and homogenously to inhibit excessive neointima proliferation and is associated with rapid healing of endothelium. As a result, DCB therapy reduces the risk of coronary thrombosis. Since only 1 to 3 months duration of dual anti-platelet therapy is required, the bleeding risk associated with prolonged dual anti-platelet therapy (DAPT) is reduced by DCB. Furthermore, there is no permanent residue of foreign bodies in the blood vessels after DCB procedure and this advantage completely eliminates adverse events associated with allergic reactions to metal, polymer and stent fracture. For side branch(SB) with a relatively small lumen in bifurcation lesions, DCB may neglect the lumen loss due to stent scaffolds and cause much less late lumen loss (LLL) than stent therapy does. For main branch(MB), no jailed SBs by the stent and the rate of SB stenosis or even occlusion will be greatly reduced.

primary_outcome.measure: QCA(quantitative coronary analysis) of efficacy of DCB
primary_outcome.time_frame: Follow-up coronary angiography at 9 months after the procedure
primary_outcome.description: late lumen loss, minimal lumen diameter

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clinical follow up at 30 days, 6, 9, 12 and 24 months after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: including cardiovascular death, target vessel related myocardial infarction and ischemia-driven revascularization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clinical follow up at 30 days, 6, 9, 12 and 24 months after the operation
secondary_outcome.description: all myocardial infarction , any revascularization and all-cause death

secondary_outcome.measure: ARC（Academic Research Consortium） defined target vessel thrombus events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clinical follow up at 30 days, 6, 9, 12 and 24 months after the operation
secondary_outcome.description: definite, probable and possible target vessel thrombus

arm_group.arm_group_label: Paclitaxel DCB for MB and SB
arm_group.description: Balloon/vessel diameter ratio 0.8-1.0, 8-10 ATM(atmosphere), lasting for >30 seconds

intervention.description: Balloon/vessel diameter ratio 0.8-1.0, 8-10 ATM, lasting for >30 seconds. If quantitative coronary angiography determines residual stenosis ≤ 30% , it is considered to be a successful operation.
intervention.arm_group_label: Paclitaxel DCB for MB and SB

intervention.description: MB should be sufficiently predilated to facilitate the positioning of the stent and the stent residual stenosis should be ≤10% to be a successful operation.
